scan_table_check.description: It may be tempting to hard code an authentication token into the HTTP Header definition for an outbound REST message. However, it should be obvious that an authentication token is to be considered a secret credential that must not be stored in code.
scan_table_check.name: CodeSanity - HTTP Header contains authentication token
scan_table_check.resolution_details: Remove the authentication token from the HTTP header. Configure to use a credential alias when invoking the REST message instead. If the Application File has been committed to source control, the authentication token must be considered as compromised and replaced.
scan_table_check.short_description: An HTTP Header must not contain any authentication tokens
scan_table_check.sys_name: CodeSanity - HTTP Header contains authentication token
